{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2961415,"name":"firstrobotcoach","username":"firstrobotcoach","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/f04885/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-07-09T21:01:45.912Z","cooked":"

Has anyone ever used codrones? I was looking to purchase them as an offseason project to focus on programming. What are your thoughts? Are they good quality products and is the curriculum for them good? They do not know Arduino Code that well, so I would like to use a product that will be simple enough for them to learn and tinker with little mentor guidance.

Any help would be greatly appreciated! Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2021-07-09T21:01:45.912Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":115.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":395006,"topic_slug":"codrone-question","display_username":"firstrobotcoach","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30595,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/codrone-question/395006/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2961440,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-09T22:53:43.134Z","cooked":"

Not used them personally.

Quick lookup online shows the curriculum is very well laid out already, quite above where most similar things I’ve seen are at. Some basic programming/python knowledge seems required, but they seem to have lots of samples and walkthroughs.

It seems that the content glosses over a lot of how quadcopters are actually controlled, which can be good or bad, depending on the desired outcomes.

Pedagogically, I see these as being able to teach core concepts of how code impacts the real world in a very real way. However, I don’t see them teaching many of the “lower level” concepts required to achieve advanced FRC functionality.

The romi platform seems better targeted at similarly-priced hardware for ramping students up on programming concepts. If your end goal is success on the field, I think I’d be starting with Romi over the quadcopters.

But, key caveat - I’ve not used either for teaching new students. Yet.
